DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Thoracic Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a person's prior radiation therapy to the chest area as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Thoracic Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's prior radiation therapy to the chest area as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Thoracic Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:(thor-ASS-ik) Having to do with the chest.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the chest.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
